docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, Oct. 2--Australia proposed today in the United Nations General Assembly's Special Political Committee a fresh approach to the problem of reported violations of fundamental human rights in Hungary, Rumania and Bulgaria.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, Oct. 2--Australia proposed today in the United Nations General Assembly's Special Political Committee a fresh approach to the problem of reported violations of fundamental human rights in Hungary, Rumania and Bulgaria.
docs.abstract: Min Spender (Australia) urges UN members file with Secretariat any evidence of further violations and end impractical probes; says 3 states' attitude shows awareness of guilt; GB and US back move; B V Cohen (US) comment

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, Oct. 3--Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt, United States delegate, today hailed the political advances made by women since the United Nations' beginning five years ago and maintained that the standards set by the charter had helped speed the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, Oct. 3--Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt, United States delegate, today hailed the political advances made by women since the United Nations' beginning five years ago and maintained that the standards set by the charter had helped speed the attainment of full suffrage rights throughout the world.

byline.original: By DAVID ANDERSON Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, Oct. 4--United Nations delegates cast a thumping 47 to 5 vote tonight in favor of an eight-power resolution on Korea carrying indirect but clear authorization for Gen. Douglas MacArthur to move across the Thirty-eighth Parallel.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, Oct. 4--United Nations delegates cast a thumping 47 to 5 vote tonight in favor of an eight-power resolution on Korea carrying indirect but clear authorization for Gen. Douglas MacArthur to move across the Thirty-eighth Parallel.
docs.abstract: 8-power resolution approved, 47-5, Assembly com; Gen MacArthur gets indirect authorization to cross 38th Parallel; Assembly approval seen; USSR-bloc plan defeated (46-5); USSR resolutions condemning US bombings defeated, 51-5; USSR resolution denouncing UNCOK defeated
